title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned in the header of the paper and repeatedly referred to throughout the text as the main focus of the research.

extractions.description: The paper proposes a Retrieval-Enhanced Machine Learning (REML) framework that integrates information retrieval systems with machine learning models to enhance generalization, scalability, robustness, and interpretability. It reviews existing models that can be viewed as special cases of REML and outlines various optimization approaches and challenges.

type.justification: The paper presents a theoretical framework for integrating information retrieval with machine learning and discusses the potential benefits and challenges without conducting specific experiments or empirical studies.
type.quote: This paper is organized in order to motivate, describe, and ground REML as a research program.

name.justification: The paper focuses on enhancing machine learning models through information retrieval techniques.
name.quote: Retrieval-Enhanced Machine Learning (REML) refers to models composed of two coupled components...

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses incorporating information retrieval techniques into machine learning.
name.quote: We propose the augmenting ML models with access to stored information through information retrieval (IR) techniques.

name.justification: The paper explicitly mentions KNN-LM as an example of models that can benefit from retrieval enhancement by linearly interpolating predictions with nearest neighbors.
name.quote: KNN-LM [32] linearly interpolates large language model predictions with the nearest neighbors of the given context input.

is_contributed.justification: KNN-LM is mentioned as an existing model related to the REML framework but not as a new contribution from this paper.
is_contributed.quote: KNN-LM [32] linearly interpolates large language model predictions with the nearest neighbors of the given context input.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not mention execution details of KNN-LM in the context of this research.
is_executed.quote: KNN-LM [32] linearly interpolates large language model predictions with the nearest neighbors of the given context input.

is_compared.justification: The paper compares the generalizability improvements from retrieval-augmented models like KNN-LM to traditional approaches.
is_compared.quote: The authors showed substantial improvements in terms of language model perplexity in both in-distribution and out-of-distribution test sets.

referenced_paper_title.value: Generalization through Memorization: Nearest Neighbor Language Models
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference title given for KNN-LM in the paper's citations.
referenced_paper_title.quote: KNN-LM [32] linearly interpolates large language model predictions with the nearest neighbors of the given context input.

name.justification: REALM is cited as a retrieval-augmented language model within the paper.
name.quote: Most existing retrieval-enhanced ML models, such as REALM [21], belong to this category.

is_contributed.justification: The paper mentions REALM as an existing example of retrieval-enhanced language models, not as a new contribution from this paper.
is_contributed.quote: Most existing retrieval-enhanced ML models, such as REALM [21], belong to this category.

is_executed.justification: There are no details provided about the execution environment for REALM in this paper.
is_executed.quote: Most existing retrieval-enhanced ML models, such as REALM [21], belong to this category.

is_compared.justification: While REALM is discussed, there is no explicit numerical comparison provided within this text.
is_compared.quote: Most existing retrieval-enhanced ML models, such as REALM [21], belong to this category.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This seems to be the reference paper for REALM cited in the context of retrieval-enhanced models.
referenced_paper_title.quote: REALM [21] accesses information from an encoded Wikipedia corpus during pre-training.
